contextId.information: This is a wish or blessing. John speaks as if these were things that God could give, although they are really ways in which  he hopes God will act for his people. AT: "May he who is ... and the seven spirits ... and Jesus Christ treat you kindly and enable you to live peacefully and securely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: May grace be to you and peace from the one who is ... and from the seven spirits ... and from Jesus Christ

contextId.information: This is a wish or prayer. Possible meanings are 1) "May people honor his glory and power" or 2) "May he have glory and power." John prays that Jesus Christ will be honored and will be able to rule completely over everyone and everything. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: to him be the glory and the power

contextId.information: "Labor" and "endurance" are abstract nouns and can be translated with verbs "work" and "endure." AT: "I know ... that you work very hard and that you endure patiently" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I know ... your hard labor and your patient endurance

contextId.information: "Sufferings" and "poverty" can be translated as verbs. AT: "I know how you have suffered and how poor you are"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I know your sufferings and your poverty

contextId.information: "Slander" can be translated as a verb. AT: "I know how those who say they are Jews have slandered you" or "I know how those who say they are Jews have said terrible things about you"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I know the slander of those who say they are Jews

contextId.information: "Faith" can be translated with the verb "believe." AT "you did not stop believing in me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you did not deny your faith in me

contextId.information: These abstract nouns can be translated with verbs. AT: "how you love, trust, serve, and endure patiently"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Your love and faith and service and your patient endurance

contextId.information: Jesus speaks of causing people to suffer as throwing them into suffering.   AT: "and I will make those who commit adultery with her to suffer greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: and those who commit adultery with her into great suffering

contextId.information: The term "heart" is often used to refer to feelings and desires. These two ideas can be translated as verbs. AT: "what people think and want" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Death is spoken of as if it were a  physical thing or person that can be hidden. AT: "people will try to find a way to die" or "people will try to kill themselves"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "power" can be translated with an adjective. "For it was the horses' mouths and tails that were so powerful" or "for it was the horses' mouths and tails that were able to hurt people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: For the power of the horses was in their mouths and in their tails

contextId.information: The word "testimony" can be expressed with the verb "testify." Also who they testified about can be stated clearly. AT: "by what they said when they testified to others about Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: by the word of their testimony

contextId.information: The word "insight" can be translated with the verb "understand". AT: "If anyone is able to understand things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The noun "condemnation" can be expressed with the verb "condemn." AT: "how God will condemn the great prostitute who is seated on many waters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the condemnation of the great prostitute who is seated on many waters

contextId.information: The noun "destruction" can be translated with a verb. AT: "Then he will be destroyed" or "Then God will destroy him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then it will go on to destruction

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "mind" and "wisdom" can be expressed with "think" and "wise" or "wisely." Why a wise mind is needed can be stated clearly. AT "A wise mind is needed in order to understand this" or "You need to think wisely in order to understand this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: This calls for a mind that has wisdom

contextId.information: The nouns "fear" and "torment" can  be expressed with phrases that tell who felt the fear and torment. AT: "because they will be afraid of how she is being tormented" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: because of the fear of her torment
